page.title: 15THE ROYAL WELSH SHOW
page.content: Every year in late July,the Royal Welsh Show comes to its permanent site at Llanelwedd,just outside Builth Wells.Nowadays,the show lasts 4 days though for many years previously,it only lasted 3 days. At one time, Wales' premier agricultural show had no permanent site and,each year,travelled around the counties of the Principality. In 1963 it was decided to site the show permanently in Mid-Wales as the cost of staging a "travelling" show was proving too great. Before the Royal Welsh came to Llanelwedd,the highest 3-day attendance was a little over 40000 whereas,in 1985,more than 52000 attended on the Wednesday alone and the total 4-day attendance was 175953. On most years, a member of the Royal Family attends the show. { {(CONTINUED) }
